definition: to consider oneself as/to believe oneself to be
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
regarding oneself as number one in terms of leadership, seniority or status

sentences.english: Shi Yuzhu with " player of class of ashes of the dead " with pose as of successful game machinator .
sentences.chinese: 史玉柱以“骨灰級玩家”和成功遊戲策劃者自居。

sentences.english: Some are branded as motels, even though they don't offer parking.
sentences.chinese: 一些品牌以汽車旅館自居，儘管他們並不提供停車場。

sentences.english: "So how can you call yourself a Jobs student," Fang asks.
sentences.chinese: “你何必以喬布斯的學生自居？”，方舟子問道。

sentences.english: Kids are like wet clay, in this view, and we are the sculptors.
sentences.chinese: 他們以雕塑家自居，而孩子就是手中那團溼溼的粘土。

sentences.english: I certainly feel like a victim but Cantamessa told me not to say that.
sentences.chinese: 我當然以無辜者自居，但坎塔梅薩告訴我不要那麼說。

sentences.english: No big or veteran party can pose as the supreme arbiter.
sentences.chinese: 任何大黨或老黨都不能以最高發言人自居。

sentences.english: Who is here so rude that would not be a Roman?
sentences.chinese: 這兒有誰願意自居化外，不願做一個羅馬人？

sentences.english: They claim to be cloud maker, and adhere to the faith that" Architecture Must Blaze".
sentences.chinese: 他們以造雲者自居，並堅持“建築必須燃燒”的信念。

sentences.english: A messianic vision such as Mr. Ahmadinejad's is rife in much of the Islamic world.
sentences.chinese: 內賈德式的以救世主自居的看法在伊斯蘭世界很普遍。

definition: to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
to view oneself
to consider oneself to be (sth positive)
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to flaunt/to advertise/to parade/boost/excessive praise
to follow blindly (idiom)/to take as one's only guide
to call oneself/to claim to be/to profess/to claim a title
to match/to suit/mutually compatible
way of doing sth/behavior/to act in an affected manner/mannerism/gestures in opera
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
see 做派[zuo4 pai4]
in the capacity of/as
Zhengtong Emperor, reign name of sixth Ming Emperor Zhu Qizhen 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
orthodox
to address sb deferentially/title/honorific
consistently/always (in the past and now)
set up on high (idiom); not in touch with reality/aloof and remote
